changes.details: Fixesssss an issue that caused F0100 (Self-diagnosis failure) when a default settings (load standard) or a set of parameters was loaded. In addition to the failure acting, changes will only take effect on the next startup.
Fixes an issue that prevented editing user parameters via the HMI's magnifying glass function.
changes.palliative: This issue does not occur when navigating through the menus.

changes.details: Relocation of fault and alarm codes was performed, removing an unnecessary gap and leaving all faults in sequential order with codes identical to the MVW01.

changes.summary: C13.2.4 Ratio between the primary and the auxiliary of the transformer
changes.details: The maximum limit of the transformation ratio between the primary voltage and the auxiliary winding of the input transformer increases from 50.00 to 90.00.

changes.summary: C1.7 General configurations of accessories installed in the MVW.
changes.details: Allows you to force the use of a specific accessory in the slots. If the accessory is configured but not installed, an error will be indicated.
All fault and alarm indications in the manual now follow the same formatting used in the HMI (Fxxxx and Axxxx).
Allows associating a digital input to the load parameter set function.

changes.summary: MVW-3000/01: Specific fault code for CIB incorrect configuration
MVW-3000: Specific fault code for failure during Manageable fault test
MVW-3000/01: Parameter load from AUI not working properly

changes.details: Fault and alarm list revision: F6 (Mains unbalance/Phase loss), deprecated. F305 (Input unbalance/phase loss), improved description.
